title.narrative: Danida Assistance to Somalia 2011-2014 Component 1: Governance & Statebuilding

description.narrative:
The Danida Somalia Programme 2011-2014 focuses on good governance and state-building, growth and employment and improved living conditions. This is Denmarks first coherent, multi-annual country program for Somalia.
Component 1: Good governance (204 mio DKK). Democracy and nation-building are essential elements in order to prevent stable regions from returning to conflict. In Somaliland and Puntland the focus is on democratization and local governance, including the strengthening of institutions necessary for the preparation and conduction of elections, while the development assistance in South-Central Somalia focuses on establishing and improving local governance. Subcomponents: 1) Democratization; 2) Somaliland Development Fund, 3) Local Control and Reform and 4) Gender equality.
Additional 30 million DKK was granted to the countryframe, of which 12 mio DKK was committed to Somalia Stability Fund and 18 mio DKK to a joint funding mechanisms in the support of the Federal Government of Somalia.
A Danida Programme Office in Hargeisa, Somaliand has been established and two international consultants are assisting the Embassy to strengthen the monitoring and coordination of Danish assistace to Somalia.
